Since the user expressed an interest in a deeper and more existential experience, I would recommend "Flatliners" or "The Good German". 

"Flatliners" presents a group of teenagers grappling with the complexities of life and death through a near-death experience. It delves into existential themes and the psychological impact of extreme situations. 

"The Good German" explores a murder investigation involving a post-war American soldier and his mistress, highlighting the moral complexities and psychological consequences of uncovering the truth.
